snippet: The Kansas Supreme Court gave the state until June 30 to fix its system of financing public schools, or face a shutdown before the next school year.
abstract: Kansas Supreme Court issues deadline of June 30 for state to fix its public school financing system; court rules Republican-controlled Legislature has not corrected inequities between poor and rich school districts and says system will be shut down if resource allocation process is not satisfactorily restructured by start of 2016-2017 school year.
lead_paragraph: The Kansas Supreme Court gave the state until June 30 to fix its system of financing public schools, or face a shutdown before the next school year.

headline.main: Court Gives Deadline to Fix Kansas School Financing
headline.print_headline: Court Gives Deadline to Fix School Financing in Kansas
